path_1.title: Eighth Grade (2018)
path_1.feeling: Authentic and awkward, but not a story I enjoy.

path_1.title: Patriot, The (2000)
path_1.feeling: Rousing and serviceable, though the history feels broad.

path_1.title: The Witches (2020)
path_1.feeling: Whimsical but thin, skewing too juvenile for me.

path_1.title: Operation Christmas Drop (2020)
path_1.feeling: Cozy holiday fluff - pleasant while it lasts, then forgettable.

path_1.title: Clockwork Orange, A (1971)
path_1.feeling: Disturbing yet riveting, with provocative ideas that linger.

path_1.title: Schumacher (2021)
path_1.feeling: Respectful portrait, but the documentary sheen feels too glossy.

path_1.title: Race (2016)
path_1.feeling: Inspiring story told in a conventional but effective way.

path_1.title: Ring, The (2002)
path_1.feeling: Creepy mystery with a satisfying investigative hook.

path_1.title: Seven (a.k.a. Se7en) (1995)
path_1.feeling: Brutal, oppressive true-crime horror I don't want to revisit.

path_1.title: Limitless (2011)
path_1.feeling: Slick, high-concept fun with enough momentum to entertain.

path_1.title: Miss Sloane (2016)
path_1.feeling: Sharp, tightly wound political drama that hits my sweet spot.

path_1.title: Greyhound (2020)
path_1.feeling: Tense naval action, focused and efficient but emotionally spare.

path_1.title: Ringu (Ring) (1998)
path_1.feeling: Eerie and restrained

path_1.title: Taxi 3 (2003)
path_1.feeling: Lightweight antics that occasionally amuse but rarely land.

path_1.title: First Man (2018)
path_1.feeling: Intimate, immersive space drama that quietly soars.

path_1.title: Dune (2021)
path_1.feeling: Majestic, immersive sci-fi that scratches my epic itch.

path_1.title: Indecent Proposal (1993)
path_1.feeling: Glossy melodrama with an intriguing premise but thin payoff.

path_1.title: Life or Something Like It (2002)
path_1.feeling: Light, agreeable diversion with a modest existential kick.

path_1.title: Red Dragon (2002)
path_1.feeling: Solid, atmospheric procedural with a chilling antagonist.

path_1.title: Associate, The (1996)
path_1.feeling: Broad but amiable comedy with a timely premise.

path_1.title: Few Good Men, A (1992)
path_1.feeling: Crackling courtroom drama that hits all the right notes.

path_1.title: Gods Must Be Crazy II, The (1989)
path_1.feeling: Pleasantly silly, though dated and uneven in laughs.

path_1.title: Whole Nine Yards, The (2000)
path_1.feeling: Breezy crime-comedy that entertains without sticking.

path_1.title: A Simple Favor (2018)
path_1.feeling: Stylish, twisty fun with a playful dark streak.

path_1.title: Fatal Attraction (1987)
path_1.feeling: Tense and engaging, if a bit sensational.

path_1.title: Trainwreck (2015)
path_1.feeling: Funny enough, with charm that offsets the formula.

path_1.title: Moxie (2021)
path_1.feeling: Earnest and well-meaning but a little heavy-handed.

path_1.title: Rudy (1993)
path_1.feeling: Classic underdog uplift that works despite predictability.

path_2.feeling: Rousing but broad historical war drama that I found serviceable more than stirring.

path_3.title: Life or Something Like It (2002)

path_3.title: Red Dragon (2002)

path_3.title: Associate, The (1996)

path_3.title: Few Good Men, A (1992)

path_3.title: Gods Must Be Crazy II, The (1989)

path_3.title: Whole Nine Yards, The (2000)

path_3.title: Moxie (2021)
path_3.feeling: Well‑intentioned but blunt and tidy, more message than compelling drama for me.

path_3.feeling: Classic underdog uplift that works as a feel‑good hit even if it’s predictable.

path_3.title: Clockwork Orange, A (1971)
path_3.feeling: Provocative and coldly incisive

path_3.feeling: Inspiring story told in a familiar, workmanlike way that held me without surprising me.

path_3.title: Ring, The (2002)

path_3.title: Seven (a.k.a. Se7en) (1995)

path_3.title: Greyhound (2020)
path_3.feeling: Taut naval action delivered craft, though it stayed at an arm’s length emotionally for me.

path_5.feeling: Light, life-reckoning dramedy with a pleasant vibe and modest impact.

path_5.title: Associate, The (1996)

path_5.feeling: Sharply argued courtroom drama that satisfies with moral stakes and punchy turns.

path_5.feeling: Breezy crime-comedy with a likable cast and modest, satisfying twists.

path_5.title: The Witches (2020)

path_5.title: Schumacher (2021)

path_5.title: Ring, The (2002)

path_5.title: Limitless (2011)
path_5.feeling: A slick, high-concept thriller whose propulsive fun outweighs its thinness.
